did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Rough draft of memo about the library at American Numismatic Society.

scopecontent.p: A four page typed draft with pencil notes in the text titled “The Library”. This gives the history of the library at ANS, describing both the physical layout of it, its contents and its organizing principle. The library was originally mostly auction catalogues and donations of members’ collections. The library acquired a paid librarian in 1911 and began using Library of Congress catalog cards in 1916. From then onwards, the library prepared various tools for finding materials in their collection. They created indexes of journals, bibliographies of materials in certain subjects, and made subject and author cards for their collection. In 1924 the library received its first Purchase Funds, followed by another gift of funds in 1941. The page versos contain numismatic plates.
